verses.roman:
kadācid atha govindo
rāmaś cādbhuta-vikramaḥ
vijahratur vane rātryāṁ
madhya-gau vraja-yoṣitām

synonyms: kadācit—on one occasion; atha—then; govindaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; rāmaḥ—Lord Balarāma; ca—and; adbhuta—wonderful; vikramaḥ—whose deeds; vijahratuḥ—the two of Them played; vane—in the forest; rātryām—at night; madhya-gau—in the midst; vraja-yoṣitām—of the women of the cowherd community.
translation: Once Lord Govinda and Lord Rāma, the performers of wonderful feats, were playing in the forest at night with the young girls of Vraja.

purport.content: This verse introduces a new pastime. According to the ācāryas, the occasion mentioned here is the Holikā-pūrṇimā, a day also known as Gaura-pūrṇimā.
